title: Question 13
prompt:
Sentence 11: Since you are looking for an employee who could grow with your company and would eventually be taking on additional responsibilities, my career goals and aspirations be well suited to this position.

Which is the best way to write the underlined portion of this sentence? If the original is the best way, choose option (A).
description: Click the <u>one best answer</u> to each question.
feedback:
The subject of the sentence, “my career goals and aspirations” is plural. It is talking about multiple goals and aspirations. The verb, “be,” is the basic or infinitive form of the verb “to be.” The correct plural present tense form of the verb is “are.” You would say “they are,” not “they be,” so the correct form is “my career goals and aspirations are.”
Since you are looking for an employee who could grow with your company and would eventually be taking on additional responsibilities, my career goals and aspirations are well suited to this position.
